author: nc1234
content: Ok so I know I worked on the spec for the reward endpoints, but I think there is some ambiguity in the spec for `total` in https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/#/Experimental/getBlockRewards on whether it is 1) Total rewards received by the proposer for performing the block proposing duty 2) Total value of the block ie. rewards for proposer + rewards for all attesters + rewards for all sync committee validators 3) Difference of proposer's prestate and poststate balance

author: nc1234
content:
Currently in the spec https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/blob/master/types/rewards.yaml#L114C71-L114C71 heavily implies 1) but would probably want to make this more obvious since `total` is being used in `consensus_block_value` in `produceBlockV3`
> description: "proposer of the block, the proposer index who receives these rewards"

author: jimmygchen
content:
This line (description for `total`) seems quite explicit? am I missing something
https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/blob/master/types/rewards.yaml#L119C25-L119C133

author: sproul
content: Agree with Jimmy that it's intended to be (1)
